snippet: As Democrats get jittery over the troubled rollout of the health care law, President Obama traveled to Texas to defend it, in the largest state to refuse to participate.
abstract: Pres Obama strongly defends his signature healthcare law in Texas, largest state that has refused to participate, while Senate Democrats call for changing or delaying key parts of coverage; promises to fix problems with program, but says refusal by Texas government to take federal funds and expand Medicaid eligibility has left more than one million people uninsured.

byline.original: By JACKIE CALMES and JONATHAN WEISMAN
byline.contributor: Jackie Calmes reported from Dallas, and Jonathan Weisman from Washington. Michael D. Shear contributed reporting from Washington, and Allison Kopicki from New York.

lead_paragraph: As Democrats get jittery over the troubled rollout of the health care law, President Obama traveled to Texas to defend it, in the largest state to refuse to participate.

headline.main: Despite Fumbles, Obama Defends Health Care Law
headline.print_headline: Despite Fumbles, Obama Defends Health Care Law

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
